result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody C. Hendrickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody C. Hendrickson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody C. Hendrickson was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
May not have VIOLENT contact with Beverly M, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

supervisions.notes:
Probation revoked.
Concurrent to 15CF1270.
Court obligations have been paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody C. Hendrickson

Revoked - Sentenced to KCJ 8/17/16
Balance Inquiry DOC#640796

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty Terry Rose. Victim present in court.  Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 1033 - Matter heard with 15CM1270. Sentence recommendations. Ct2: Defendant is sentenced to 9 months in the Kenosha County Jail - concurrent to 15CM1270. Credit for 121 days. Appeal rights given. No additional costs ordered. Any costs remaining as outstanding are to be converted to civil judgment.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Terry Rose.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  828 - Matter heard with 15CM1543. DE has a sentencing in Br3 this morning. Adjournment requested to allow review of revocation packet - granted.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing scheduled 8/3 @ 8:30am.
To linked case #15CM1270
Per Judge Milisauskas - Remaining bond from 15CM1543 may be linked to 15CM1270 for payment of costs.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement
Waiver of Rights
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Diane Caspari.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1031 - Matter heard with 15CM1270. DE enters plea of guilty as to Ct2 - found guilty by the court. Ct1 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations made. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions. 8 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs ordered.  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay $200 DNA surcharge and notice was given.  No restitution requested.  Appeal rights given.

MINUTES:  217 - MH scheduled because the court didn't receive authorization from the DE to have Atty Fields-Bowers withdraw. Motion to Withdraw granted forthwith. Atty Caspari taking over case.
